org.apache.felix.ipojo.manipulator
Class Pojoization

java.lang.Object
  org.apache.felix.ipojo.manipulator.Pojoization

public class Pojoization
extends java.lang.Object

Pojoization allows creating an iPOJO bundle from a "normal" bundle.

Author:
Felix Project Team

Referenced packages by the composite.

m_ignoreAnnotations

private boolean m_ignoreAnnotations
Flag describing if we need or not compute annotations. By default, compute the annotations.

m_ignoreLocalXSD

private boolean m_ignoreLocalXSD
Flag describing if we need or not use local XSD files (i.e. use the SchemaResolver or not). If true the local XSD are not used.

m_inputJar

private java.util.jar.JarFile m_inputJar
Input jar file.

pojoization

public void pojoization(java.io.File in,
                        java.io.File out,
                        java.io.InputStream metadata)
Manipulates an input bundle. This method creates an iPOJO bundle based on the given metadata file. The original and final bundles must be different.

Parameters:
in - the original bundle.
out - the final bundle.
metadata - the iPOJO metadata input stream.

pojoization

public void pojoization(java.io.File in,
                        java.io.File out,
                        java.io.File metadataFile)
Manipulates an input bundle. This method creates an iPOJO bundle based on the given metadata file. The original and final bundles must be different.

Parameters:
in - the original bundle.
out - the final bundle.
metadataFile - the iPOJO metadata file (XML).

directoryPojoization

public void directoryPojoization(java.io.File directory,
                                 java.io.File metadataFile,
                                 java.io.File manifestFile)
Manipulates an expanded bundles. Classes are in the specified directory. this method allows to update a customized manifest.

Parameters:
directory - the directory containing classes
metadataFile - the metadata file
manifestFile - the manifest file. null to use directory/META-INF/MANIFEST.mf

Parse the content of the class to detect annotated classes.

Parameters:
inC - the class to inspect.

getInputStream

private java.io.InputStream getInputStream(java.lang.String classname)
                                    throws java.io.IOException
Gets an input stream on the given class. This methods manages Jar files and directories.

Parameters:
classname - the class name
Returns:
the input stream
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if the file cannot be read

getClassFiles

private java.util.Enumeration getClassFiles()
Gets the list of class files. The content of the returned enumeration contains file names. It is possible to get input stream on those file by using the getInputStream(String) method.

Returns:
the list of class files.

searchClassFiles

private void searchClassFiles(java.io.File dir,
                              java.util.List classes)
Navigates across directories to find class files.

Parameters:
dir - the directory to analyze
classes - discovered classes

computeRelativePath

private java.lang.String computeRelativePath(java.lang.String absolutePath)
Computes a relative path for the given absolute path. This methods computes the relative path according to the directory containing classes for the given class path.

Parameters:
absolutePath - the absolute path of the class
Returns:
the relative path of the class based on the directory containing classes.

manipulateInnerClass

private void manipulateInnerClass(java.io.InputStream clazz,
                                  java.lang.String cn,
                                  Pojoization.ComponentInfo ci)
                           throws java.io.IOException
Manipulates an inner class.

Parameters:
clazz - input stream on the inner file to manipulate
cn - the inner class name (ends with .class)
ci - component info of the component owning the inner class
Throws:
java.io.IOException - the inner class cannot be read

getManifest

private java.util.jar.Manifest getManifest()
                                    throws java.io.IOException
Gets the manifest. This method handles Jar and directories. For Jar file, the input jar manifest is returned. For directories, if specified the specifies manifest is returned. Otherwise, try directory/META-INF/MANIFEST.MF

Returns:
the Manifest.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if the manifest cannot be found

doManifest

private java.util.jar.Manifest doManifest()
Create the manifest. Set the bundle imports and iPOJO-components clauses

Returns:
the generated manifest.

manipulateComponent

private byte[] manipulateComponent(byte[] in,
                                   Pojoization.ComponentInfo ci)
Manipulate a component class.

Parameters:
in - : the byte array of the class to manipulate
ci - : attached component info (containing metadata and manipulation metadata)
Returns:
the generated class (byte array)

computeDeclaredComponents

private void computeDeclaredComponents()
Return the list of "concrete" component.

setCreatedBy

private void setCreatedBy(java.util.jar.Attributes att)
Set the create-by in the manifest.

Parameters:
att - : manifest attribute.

setImports

private void setImports(java.util.jar.Attributes att)
Add imports to the given manifest attribute list. This method add ipojo imports and handler imports (if needed).

Parameters:
att - : the manifest attribute list to modify.

setPOJOMetadata

private void setPOJOMetadata(java.util.jar.Attributes att)
Add iPOJO-Components to the given manifest attribute list. This method add the iPOJO-Components header and its value (according to the metadata) to the manifest.

Parameters:
att - : the manifest attribute list to modify.

parseHeader

public java.util.Map parseHeader(java.lang.String value)
Standard OSGi header parser. This parser can handle the format clauses ::= clause ( ',' clause ) + clause ::= name ( ';' name ) (';' key '=' value ) This is mapped to a Map { name => Map { attr|directive => value } }

Parameters:
value - : String to parse.
Returns:
parsed map.

printClauses

public java.lang.String printClauses(java.util.Map exports,
                                     java.lang.String allowedDirectives)
Print a standard Map based OSGi header.

Parameters:
exports - : map { name => Map { attribute|directive => value } }
allowedDirectives - : list of allowed directives.
Returns:
the clauses

parseXMLMetadata

private void parseXMLMetadata(java.io.File metadataFile)
Parse the XML metadata from the given file.

Parameters:
metadataFile - the metadata file

parseXMLMetadata

private void parseXMLMetadata(java.io.InputStream stream)
Parses XML Metadata.

Parameters:
stream - metadata input stream.

private java.util.List getReferredPackages()
Get packages referenced by component.

the list of referenced packages.

buildManifestMetadata

private java.lang.StringBuffer buildManifestMetadata(Element element,
                                                     java.lang.StringBuffer actual)
Generate manipulation metadata.

Parameters:
element - : actual element.
actual - : actual manipulation metadata.
Returns:
: given manipulation metadata + manipulation metadata of the given element.
